answers.answer: Hi!This is a relatively new technique getting FDA or USA’s Food and Drug Administration Department’s approval only in September 2010. The success rate varies from individual to individual. Also you should not have any underlying disease causing fat deposition such as diabetes, hypothyroidism, high cholesterol etc. Please discuss with your specialist. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

Thank you for your response, I did have my bloodwork done, thyroid was fine, cholestrol a little high, estrogen low(so that could be the culprit,) no mention of diabetes or insulin resistance, but I will look into this further.Thank you, and have a great week!Robyn

question: Anyone had success with coolsculpt, I had adv protocol and seven weeks out, minimal change. ;-(
title: coolsculpt
